line.comment: * Task 0.
* This fleet is an attack fleet. Here are its targets:
* 1/ Jump Beacons and Advanced Satellites in sectors [OWNER] claims, + adjacent sectors, except Unknown. And also in [OWNER] sectors claimed by another race.
* 2/ Hostile ships in sectors [OWNER] claims. We don't defend, Border Patrol and Rearguard are here for that.
* 3/ Reprisal. Whenever a Task Force kills a ship, its RelValue is added to a global var (mayhem_reprisals). If this value is > 0, this Task Force will try to balance things out.
* 4/ Jump Beacons and Advanced Satellites in all [OWNER] reachable sectors, if the race is hostile.
* 5/ Random chance of targetting enemy freighters in [OWNER] reachable sectors.
* Zero Hour: during the global alliance only supporting OCV hunters (strong Rearguards)
* we always want a TM leader, he should not switch again
*if not [THIS]-> get local variable: name='ZH.raidingTaskForce'
*end
* we join an OCV Hunter Group and try to fall in line behind the border patrols
* Zero Hour AI: -1=full defense ; 0=cautious ; 1=baseline (vanilla Mayhem 3) ; 2=confident ; 3=reckless
* if our Battlegroups are not available we can partially do their job and conquer empty sectors adjacent to our territory
* there is a small chance to also go for non-border sectors, so that they eventually get conquered. blocking tactics by the player won't work forever
* If the sector was empty, or Unknown, it's best to stay in the area for a while.
* RAIDING
* (because Task Forces can only retreat when in own sectors)
* fully defensive or cautious AI cannot raid
* new raids require full strength
* Full Defense & Tyrant AIs can also raid
* *^^^ we don't react to attacks (!ship.signal.attacked) and try to fly safe (Mayhem.Task.Move)
* cannot go to a new raid at only partial strength
* small chance to go build yourself up to full strength
* choosing a new sector to raid
* respect the blacklist only for our sectors
* avoid the main faction war
* no alerted sectors
* new raids must always start in border sectors.
* scanning for military presence, big ships only
* we don't have enough freighter targets here and also couldn't find more sectors which are suited for raiding
* if $raidSector
* skip if [SECTOR] == $raidSector
* goto label Restart:
* end
* start raiding
* opportunistically attacking player Jump Beacons
* going only after total war enemy freighters with resources in them
* rogue nations can raid all enemy freighters
* others only freighters of their total/coalition/permanent war enemies
* not enough freighters here
* ** not Raiding
* if size of array $targets
* Return home if we were in mission.
* $targets = array alloc: size=0
* gosub GoHomeSector:
* goto label Restart:
* end
* we can only cover the area near our homebase
* first take out TMs and satellites + player jump beacons in our unalerted border sectors
* then do the same also in alerted and core sectors. But never in claimed or dangerous sectors (stay away from the main frontlines).
* then just defend where you are, unless you are actively searching for empty sectors to claim
* don't stay in just one general area hunting satellites all the time. After each Attack we have a small chance to switch homebase
* when we want to snatch more empty sectors our Task Forces have a much higher chance go into other areas of the galaxy
* trying to escape 2 jumps further. Route must be safe and also have enough different jump gates to remain flexible.
* a large enemy is here (and not just passing through). We should run away into a different direction
* we are trapped !
* leaving our enemy behind
* first leaving for any nearby safe sector, then going to repair at our nearest Outpost. Using fly Safe for both moves.
* we got cornered inside hostile territory, far away from home.
* should we survive anyway we try to leave and repair
* try to continue your raid but back away a sector
* skirmishing and full extraction are both not possible! We prepare to enter Valhalla!
* survived last stand
* we often have to cross large distance. Using the raiding variable makes us try to fly on a safe path and avoid to defend ourself

sval.val: Escorting %s
Escorting %s
Opportunistic claim on %s
Calculating Raid
Raiding %s
No targets
Defending %s
Attacking %s
Attacking %s
Going home
Trying to escape
Avoiding %s
Backing away to %s
Leaving Raid Zone
Last Stand in %s
Regrouping to %s
Task 0.
This fleet is an attack fleet. Here are its targets:
1/ Jump Beacons and Advanced Satellites in sectors [OWNER] claims, + adjacent sectors, except Unknown. And also in [OWNER] sectors claimed by another race.
2/ Hostile ships in sectors [OWNER] claims. We don't defend, Border Patrol and Rearguard are here for that.
3/ Reprisal. Whenever a Task Force kills a ship, its RelValue is added to a global var (mayhem_reprisals). If this value is > 0, this Task Force will try to balance things out.
4/ Jump Beacons and Advanced Satellites in all [OWNER] reachable sectors, if the race is hostile.
5/ Random chance of targetting enemy freighters in [OWNER] reachable sectors.
Zero Hour: during the global alliance only supporting OCV hunters (strong Rearguards)
we always want a TM leader, he should not switch again
if not [THIS]-> get local variable: name='ZH.raidingTaskForce'
we join an OCV Hunter Group and try to fall in line behind the border patrols
Zero Hour AI: -1=full defense ; 0=cautious ; 1=baseline (vanilla Mayhem 3) ; 2=confident ; 3=reckless
if our Battlegroups are not available we can partially do their job and conquer empty sectors adjacent to our territory
there is a small chance to also go for non-border sectors, so that they eventually get conquered. blocking tactics by the player won't work forever
If the sector was empty, or Unknown, it's best to stay in the area for a while.
(because Task Forces can only retreat when in own sectors)
fully defensive or cautious AI cannot raid
new raids require full strength
Full Defense & Tyrant AIs can also raid
*^^^ we don't react to attacks (!ship.signal.attacked) and try to fly safe (Mayhem.Task.Move)
cannot go to a new raid at only partial strength
small chance to go build yourself up to full strength
choosing a new sector to raid
respect the blacklist only for our sectors
avoid the main faction war
no alerted sectors
new raids must always start in border sectors.
scanning for military presence, big ships only
we don't have enough freighter targets here and also couldn't find more sectors which are suited for raiding
if $raidSector
skip if [SECTOR] == $raidSector
goto label Restart:
start raiding
opportunistically attacking player Jump Beacons
going only after total war enemy freighters with resources in them
rogue nations can raid all enemy freighters
others only freighters of their total/coalition/permanent war enemies
not enough freighters here
** not Raiding
if size of array $targets
Return home if we were in mission.
$targets = array alloc: size=0
gosub GoHomeSector:
goto label Restart:
we can only cover the area near our homebase
first take out TMs and satellites + player jump beacons in our unalerted border sectors
then do the same also in alerted and core sectors. But never in claimed or dangerous sectors (stay away from the main frontlines).
then just defend where you are, unless you are actively searching for empty sectors to claim
don't stay in just one general area hunting satellites all the time. After each Attack we have a small chance to switch homebase
when we want to snatch more empty sectors our Task Forces have a much higher chance go into other areas of the galaxy
trying to escape 2 jumps further. Route must be safe and also have enough different jump gates to remain flexible.
a large enemy is here (and not just passing through). We should run away into a different direction
we are trapped !
leaving our enemy behind
first leaving for any nearby safe sector, then going to repair at our nearest Outpost. Using fly Safe for both moves.
we got cornered inside hostile territory, far away from home.
should we survive anyway we try to leave and repair
try to continue your raid but back away a sector
skirmishing and full extraction are both not possible! We prepare to enter Valhalla!
survived last stand
we often have to cross large distance. Using the raiding variable makes us try to fly on a safe path and avoid to defend ourself
